erds.name: Model Number
erds.description: The identifier used to specify what group an appliance belongs to. Unused bytes should be set to 0x00.

erds.name: Serial Number
erds.description: The unique identifier used to individualize an appliance within a group. Unused bytes should be set to 0x00.

erds.name: Control User Interface Locked
erds.description: Specifies whether the user interface for the appliance is currently locked, preventing interaction.

erds.name: Clock Time
erds.description: The current time of the appliance, as displayed on the user interface. Note that this is considered to be the local time of the user.

erds.name: Clock Format
erds.description: The current format used for displaying time to the user.

erds.name: Temperature Display Units
erds.description: The current units used for displaying temperature to the user.

erds.name: Appliance Type
erds.description: A unique identifier used to specify the type of the appliance. Only 1 Board within the appliance should respond to the Appliance Type ERD. The board that responds must be the main board that hosts the Public ERDs.

erds.name: Sabbath Mode
erds.description: Specifies whether Sabbath is being observed.

erds.name: Sound Level
erds.description: The current level of which sounds are played to the user.

erds.name: Line Input Voltage
erds.description: The Line Input voltage in hundredths

erds.name: Ready to Enter Boot Loader
erds.description: Indicates whether an appliance is ready to enter boot loader mode.

data.name: Ready to enter boot loader state

values.2: Not ready to enter boot loader

erds.name: Reset Board
erds.description: When this ERD changes, the board will reset after the number of seconds specified in the data. After reset the value of this ERD is 255 to enable ERD change detection therefore 255 as a reset value is unsupported.

erds.name: System Current
erds.description: The current draw of the system.

erds.name: Personality (32-bit)
erds.description:
This value should summarize the "personality" for all of the boards in an appliance. The value of
the personality does not necessarily need to have a specific meaning, but must be different for
each meaningfully different configuration. For example, if different models require different
parametric images, the personality for all configurations with different parametric images must
have distinct personality values so that the personality could be used to identify and deliver an
appropriate update package. If there is any confusion about how this value should be assigned you
should work with your service team to help define your personalities.

erds.name: Service Mode State Request
erds.description: Request that an appliance change its service mode state.

erds.name: Service Mode State
erds.description: Current service mode state for an appliance.

erds.name: Supported Image Types
erds.description: Specifies the supported image types for a board.

erds.name: Boot Loader Version
erds.description: Specifies the boot loader version for a board. Valid only if the boot loader image type is supported. See 0x0038.

erds.name: Application Version
erds.description: Specifies the application version for a board. Valid only if the application image type is supported. See 0x0038.

erds.name: Parametric Version
erds.description: Specifies the parametric version for a board. Valid only if the parametric image type is supported. See 0x0038.

erds.name: Auxiliary Version
erds.description: Specifies the auxiliary version for a board. Valid only if the auxiliary image type is supported. See 0x0038.

erds.name: Enhanced Sabbath Mode Status
erds.description: Specifies whether Enhanced Sabbath Mode is active.

erds.name: Timer
erds.description: The number of minutes remaining for the timer on the user interface.

erds.name: Available Sound Levels
erds.description: List of available sound levels that the unit supports

erds.name: Configuration Hash
erds.description: SHA-256 hash for a configuration data JSON document

erds.name: Brand ID
erds.description: A unique identifier used to specify the Brand of the appliance.

values.1: GEA - Covers all GEA Brands (GE, Profile, Cafe, Monogram, Hotpoint)

erds.name: Matter Product ID
erds.description: The Matter Product ID assigned by the CSA (Connectivity Standards Alliance)

erds.name: Hosted Firmware Status
erds.description: The state of software update that the appliance is in.

erds.name: Alexa Registration Request
erds.description: Used to request a device register with the Alexa Cloud

erds.name: Alexa Status
erds.description: Status of the embedded Alexa voice module

erds.name: Matter Device Identify Type
erds.description: The type of action the Matter device takes to identify itself.

erds.name: Matter Device Identify Time Actual
erds.description: The amount of time remaining (in seconds) that the device is in identify mode.

erds.name: Matter Device Identify Time Request
erds.description: Requested time (in seconds) for device to enter identify mode.

erds.name: Matter Device On-Off Request
erds.description: Turn on or turn off the front panel/display of a Matter device.

erds.name: Matter Device On-Off State
erds.description: The panel/display on-off status of a Matter device.

erds.name: Matter Device Temperature Display Mode Request
erds.description: Request Matter device to change the temperature display units (Celsius or Fahrenheit).

erds.name: Matter Device Temperature Display Mode Actual
erds.description: Temperature display units (Celsius or Fahrenheit) of a Matter device.

erds.name: Matter Device Keypad Lockout
erds.description: Keypad lockout level of a Matter device.

erds.name: Matter Device Onboarding Pairing Code
erds.description: The pairing code used in the Matter device commissioning process.

erds.name: Matter Commissioning Mode Request
erds.description: This is the request to open or close the Matter commissioning window

erds.name: Matter Commissioning Window State
erds.description: This is the current state of the Matter commissioning window

erds.name: Matter Fabric Count
erds.description: This is the number of Fabrics that the Matter device is commissioned to

data.name: The number of Matter Fabrics that the device is commissioned to

erds.name: Video Stream
erds.description: This ERD initiates or stops video streaming at a given resolution. Selecting a resolution above capability will result in the highest available resolution.

erds.name: Still Frame
erds.description: This ERD initiates a jpeg image capture. Resolution needs to match those available in ERD 0x0500

erds.name: Camera Stream Authentication Status
erds.description: This ERD indicates the camera stream authentication status.

erds.name: Camera Stream Termination Reason
erds.description: This ERD records the camera stream termination reason for a previously terminated stream. It should be cleared to 00 when a new stream is initiated.

erds.name: Image Upload Inference ID
erds.description:
PictureId is a UUID v4 generated cloud side for each unique picture uploaded.
InferenceId is UUID v4 generated cloud side for each unique inference performed on a picture.
Data is written to the appliance as a single 32 byte ERD to indicate to the firmware that an inference is complete.  The firmware would then be responsible for calling an HTTP endpoint to access the JSON payload for the picture and inference to get the full results.

Link to usage: https://geappliances.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SHSCT/pages/3248423054/Appliance+Vision+AI#ERD-Structure'

erds.name: Image Capture Currently Available
erds.description: This ERD is used for appliances to identify to clients that support cameras if the system is in a state that is currently acceptable for capturing images. This could be related to anything pertinent to this particular appliance state, some examples are: Is the Oven light ON in the Oven cavity? Is the door open and the camera is mounted on the door? For the latter example, a system may indicate that streaming is available but privacy filtering should be applied to the image capture with 02

erds.name: Supported Enhanced Features
erds.description: This ERD is used for Core-Enhanced-Cloud (CEC) feature deployment. It provides a list of enhanced features currently supported by the appliance firmware.

erds.name: Request Enabled Enhanced Features
erds.description: This ERD is used for requesting Core-Enhanced-Cloud (CEC) feature deployment. It allows request for enabling and disabling the features supported by the firmware. This ERD represents request to enable/disable of a digital feature by referring to the slots of supported features in 0x0600

erds.name: Current Enabled Enhanced Features
erds.description: This ERD is used to enable Core-Enhanced-Cloud (CEC) feature deployment. It allows enabling and disabling the features supported by the firmware. This ERD represents enable/disable of a digital feature by referring to the slots of supported feature in 0x0600

erds.name: Current Sound Theme
erds.description: Specifies the current sound theme being used.

erds.name: Sound Theme Request
erds.description: Request to change the current sound theme.

erds.name: Supported Sound Themes
erds.description: Specifies all the supported sound themes in the appliance.

erds.name: Sign of Life
erds.description:
Periodically changing value that should be written to the device to prove that the client is communicative. The client can
listen for publications of this ERD to determine whether the device is communicative. This can be written open loop because
the value written has no meaning except that it should change periodically.

erds.name: UI Sound Level Request
erds.description: Used to request the desired sound level from the UI.

erds.name: UI Sound Level State
erds.description: The current sound level setting.

erds.name: Number of Sound Level Settings
erds.description: Maximum sound level setting

erds.name: Battery Level
erds.description: Current battery level as a percentage of full charge.

erds.name: Battery Is Charging
erds.description: Current battery charge state. True if charging, false if not charging.

erds.name: Appliance Is Plugged Into Wall
erds.description: Specifies whether an appliance is plugged into a wall outlet. Relevant for battery-powered appliances.

erds.name: Battery Temperature
erds.description: Current battery temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.

erds.name: Battery Health
erds.description: Current battery health (capacity) as a percentage of original capacity.

erds.name: Display Temperature
erds.description:
The actual temperature of the unit fresh food and freezer compartment.
ERD should not be used when both data values are set to 127.

erds.name: Desired Temperature
erds.description:
Used to read or write the desired fresh food and freezer setpoint temperature for the unit.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
Both values should be written according to limits defined in ERD 0x100B;
except for special case to turn off the cooling system in the unit.
Only Wine Chiller and Beverage Center (appliance types 24 and 25) support this ERD 
to turn cooling off by writing 100 to both values.
Cooling is turned back on by writing any other setpoint within limits such as
default values: 37 for fresh food and 0 for freezer.

erds.name: Door Alarm Alert
erds.description: Specifies which door alarms are active on the appliance.

erds.name: Ice Maker Bucket Status
erds.description:
Used to read the fresh food and freezer ice maker presence and bucket full information.
Ice maker present bits (0 or 1) should be checked before reading bucket full bits (2 and 3).
Bucket full status should be ignored when ice maker is reported not present. 
ERD 0x100A should be updated taking into consideration the presence data from this ERD.

data.name: Fresh Food Ice Maker Bucket Full

erds.name: Water Filter Status
erds.description: The state of the water filter.

values.0: Filter Does Not Need To Be Ordered

erds.name: Ice Maker Control
erds.description:
Used to read or write the desired fresh food and freezer ice maker state.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
Both values should be written in ERD. 
ERD should not be used when both values are set to 255 (Not Applicable);
but it is acceptable to just have a single ice maker in the unit. 
If one of the ice maker data is set to 255; then value should be maintained 
while updating the other ice maker.

erds.name: Temperature Limits
erds.description: The minimum and maximum values for the desired temperature.

erds.name: Humidity Control
erds.description:
Used to read or write the current mode for humidity mitigation.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD should not be used when data is 255 (Not equipped).

erds.name: Quick Ice Status
erds.description:
Used to read or write the quick ice feature status.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD should not be used when data is 255 (Not equipped).

erds.name: Turbo Freeze Status
erds.description:
Used to read or write the turbo freeze feature status.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD should not be used when data is 255 (Not equipped).

erds.name: Turbo Cool Status
erds.description:
Used to read or write the turbo cool feature status.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD should not be used when data is 255 (Not equipped).

erds.name: Hot Water Status
erds.description:
Used to read the state of the hot water dispenser.
ERD should not be used when status data is 255 (Not Applicable).

values.0: Not Present (Hot Water and K-cup capable type)
values.1: Present (Hot Water and K-cup capable type)

erds.name: Hot Water Desired Temperature
erds.description:
Used to read or write the desired temperature of the hot water.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD 0x1018 should be read before writing this ERD.
Temperature should only be written when ERD 0x1018 status is 0 (Available).
ERD should not be used when ERD 0x1010 status is 255 (Not Applicable).

erds.name: Deli Pan Selection
erds.description: The selected position of the deli pan.

erds.name: Deli Pan Desired Temperature
erds.description: The desired temperature of the deli pan. Please note that values greater than or equal to 99 degrees Fahrenheit are not allowed.

erds.name: Door Status
erds.description: The state of the door.

erds.name: Altitude Status
erds.description:

erds.name: Hot Water Local Use
erds.description:
Used to read the usage status of hot water.
ERD 0x1011 should not be written when status is different than 0 (Available).

erds.description: The type of water filter in this unit.

erds.name: Nighttime Snack Mode Status
erds.description: Nighttime Snack Mode feature is turned on or off.

erds.name: Nighttime Snack Mode Timeout
erds.description: The number of minutes for Nighttime Snack Mode.  If 0, the program will use the default of 12 hours.  If a change is made to this parameter while NSM is active, the active timeout will not change.

erds.name: Convertible Drawer Mode Selection
erds.description:
Used to read or write the convertible drawer mode.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD should not be used when data is 255 (Not Controllable).
Allowed modes for the current unit are defined in ERD 0x1021.

erds.name: Convertible Drawer Modes Temperature
erds.description:
Used to read the temperature and message label ID for each convertible drawer mode.
A given mode is not used when temperature is set to 100 and label ID is 255.
ERD should be ignored when all modes are unused.

erds.name: Desired Adjustable Convertible Drawer Setting
erds.description:
Used to read or write the desired adjustable convertible drawer setting.
Legacy ERD that it does not follow Request/Status ERDs' architecture.
ERD should not be used when mode data is 255 (Not Controllable).
Allowed settings for the current unit are defined in ERD 0x1023.

erds.name: Adjustable Convertible Drawer Temperature Limits
erds.description:
Used to read the label ID, default, minimum, and maximum temperatures for each adjustable Convertible Drawer mode.
Specific mode is not used when temperatures are set to 100 and label ID is 255.
ERD should be ignored when all modes are unused.

erds.name: Food Mode Presets Configuration
erds.description:
Specify up to ten preset food mode combinations for user selection via mobile app. 
A food mode combination, or preset, specifies a food mode for each compartment of a triple 
compartment refrigerator.
This ERD acts as an allow-list of food mode compartment combinations. 
An allow-list is used as certain food mode compartment combinations may be difficult for the 
refrigeration control system, and that may result in a poor user experience.

Unused food mode preset slots should have their compartment food modes set to 'Not Applicable'.

Also see, ERD 0x1058 - Food Mode Preset Actual and ERD 0x1059 - Food Mode Preset (Desired).
These ERDs are used to select and report the users food mode combination preset selection.

erds.name: System Startup Time in Minutes After Last Power Outage
erds.description: Reports the time in minutes when the unit was powered up after the last power outage.

data.name: System Startup Time After Last Power Outage (Minutes)

erds.name: Machine State
erds.description: The current state of the laundry machine.

erds.name: Sub Cycle State
erds.description: The current sub-cycle of the laundry machine.

erds.name: Remote End Of Cycle State
erds.description:
Specifies whether the laundry machine has ended the current cycle.
Used to notify the remote user that the cycle is complete.

erds.name: Remaining Cycle Time
erds.description:
The amount of time in seconds remaining before the laundry cycle completes.

Depends on
  - 0x2000 Machine State Must be Run.

erds.name: Tank Status
erds.description: The state of each of the laundry tanks.

erds.name: Tank Selected
erds.description: Specifies which of the laundry tanks are selected.

erds.name: Laundry Current Selected Cycle
erds.description:
The currently selected cycle of the laundry machine.
- Note 1: The data field in this file is also used by 0x206B and 0x20A7.
- Note 2: A change in this file requires a corresponding change in 0x20A8.

erds.name: Laundry Operating Mode
erds.description:
The mode of operation for the laundry machine.

Notes
- This is really a legacy ERD and in the past was not a member of any API.
- It has recently been added to an API to be future compatible.

erds.name: Delay Time Remaining Minutes
erds.description:
The amount of delay time remaining in minutes.

Depends On
- 0x2000 Machine State must be DelayRun or DelayPause.

Note: some Mabe products have this ERD incorrectly implemented as writable. The app depends upon this being writable for these products.

erds.name: Lid Switch State
erds.description: Current state of the door/lid'

erds.name: Lid Lock Actual State
erds.description: Lid/Door lock state

erds.name: Add Garment
erds.description: Indicates when it is ok to add a garment to the machine.

erds.name: Legacy - Washer Remote Soil Level Option
erds.description: Specifies the option value for soil level in UI module.

erds.name: Legacy - Washer Remote Wash Temperature Level
erds.description: Specifies the option value for wash temperature level.

erds.name: Legacy Remote Spin Time Level
erds.description: Specifies the option value for spin time level.

erds.name: Washer Remote Rinse Option
erds.description: Specifies the option value for rinse.

erds.name: Legacy - Dryer Extended Tumble Selection
erds.description:
Specifies Extended Tumble selection.

Notes:
- This is really a legacy ERD and in the past was not a member of any API.
- It has recently been added to an API to be future compatible.
- Maintained for Legacy App Versions
- In legacy units
  - writing to this ERD will set the ExtendedTumble Selection
- Modern units maintain this ERD for compatibility with Legacy Apps
  - writing to this ERD will send a request for this change to 0x2051 Extended Tumble Option Request
  - if enable request is granted then a request is sent to disable EcoDry via 0x2044 EcoDry Option Request
  - 0x201B Dryer Extended Tumble Selection is maintained to match 0x2053 Extended Tumble Option Selection
- Prefer using the Extended Tumble API

erds.name: Dryer Cycle Type
erds.description: Indicates the Cycle Type of the currently selected cycle (Sensor, Timed, Steam...)

erds.name: End Of Cycle Alarm Notification
erds.description:
Indicates whether an End of Cycle user notification is required.

This ERD will change to "User notification required":
- After some duration of time has passed since entering the End Of Cycle state and
- the user has not opened the lid/door and
- has not started a new cycle.

This ERD will change back to "No user notification required"
- When the user starts a cycle or
- opens the lid/door.

erds.name: Connected Select Cycle
erds.description: Specifies Connected Selected Cycle.  When writing to connected cycle Erd, the value must be one that is listed by the available connected cycle Erd 0x2021.

erds.name: Available Connect Cycles
erds.description: Returns the cycles that are available to be selected via 0x2020. If all values are '0' then no connect cycle is available.

erds.name: Dryer Sheet Usage Configuration
erds.description:
Specifies the number of dryer sheets the customer will typically use in a cycle for Small, Medium, Large, Extra Large and timed dry cycles.

Only Small, Large and Timed Dry configurations are used at this time.

data.name: Small Load Size Dryer Sheets Per Cycle
Medium Load Size Dryer Sheets Per Cycle
Large Load Size Dryer Sheets Per Cycle
Extra Large Load Size Dryer Sheets Per Cycle
Timed Dry Dryer Sheets Per Cycle

erds.name: Dryer Sheets Remaining
erds.description:
Remaining number of dryer sheets

Depends on
  - 0x2022 Dryer Sheet Usage Configuration
    - Device will decrement 0x2023 Dryer Sheets Remaining according to 0x2022 Dryer Sheet Usage Configuration as cycles are run.

When updating 0x2023 Dryer Sheets Remaining, it is the client's responsibility to determine the value to write.

erds.name: Warm Rinse Option
erds.description: Specifies the option value for warm rinse.

erds.name: Drain Pump Actual State
erds.description: Specifies the current state of the drain pump.

erds.name: Drive Motor Target Basket Speed
erds.description: The target basket speed in RPM. Positive target indicates clockwise, negative target indicates counter clockwise.

erds.name: Actual Basket Speed
erds.description: The current basket speed. Note direction is not reflected in this value.

erds.name: Water Valves Actual State
erds.description: The states of all the water valves in the system.

erds.name: Max Water Level
erds.description: The maximum water level seen in the system since ERD reset.  ERD is 0 on initial creation and is stored in nonvolatile memory.  If the ERD is never reset externally it represents the max water level seen for the life of the system.

data.name: Max Water Level Inches of water x 1000 (inches)

erds.name: Smart Dispense Usage Profile Record Small
erds.description: Number of times a cycle has been run with the "small" setting of smart dispense. Count should be increased upon cycle end. Counter should not roll over when it reaches max.

erds.name: Smart Dispense Usage Profile Record Medium
erds.description: Number of times a cycle has been run with the "medium" setting of smart dispense. Count should be increased upon cycle end. Counter should not roll over when it reaches max.

erds.name: Smart Dispense Usage Profile Record Large
erds.description: Number of times a cycle has been run with the "large" setting of smart dispense. Count should be increased upon cycle end. Counter should not roll over when it reaches max.

erds.name: Smart Dispense Usage Profile Record Auto
erds.description: Number of times a cycle has been run with the "auto" setting of smart dispense. Count should be increased upon cycle end. Counter should not roll over when it reaches max.

erds.name: Remote Set Delay Start Minutes
erds.description:
Write this ERD to set the Delay Start Time in minutes or start the Delay Start
- 0 through 1440 inclusive are allowed values.
- 0 will start the Delay Start cycle immediately.

Depends on:
- ERD 0x2000 must be Delay Run or Delay Pause.
- ERD 0x2039 must be Enabled

Read
- 0xFFFF = Request processed

erds.name: Remote Status
erds.description:
Indicates if a cycle can be started remotely.

Enabled indicates the ERDs 0x2038, 0x2040 and 0x2041 may be written.

ERD 0x2039 is a member of both
- API V1 "Remote Start and Stop"
- API V2 "Remote Start and Stop V2"

API V2 Remote Start and Stop V2 takes precedence.

values.255: Model does not support remote operation

erds.name: Smart Dispense Usage Profile Record Less
erds.description: Number of times a Smart Dispense cycle has been run with the "Less" user selection. Count is increased when the cycle ends. The count does not roll over when it reaches max.

erds.name: Smart Dispense Usage Profile Record More
erds.description: Number of times a Smart Dispense cycle has been run with the "More" user selection. Count is increased when the cycle ends. The count does not roll over when it reaches max.

erds.name: Bulk Detergent Tank Level
erds.description: Amount of detergent left in the Smart Dispense bulk detergent tank.

data.name: Smart Dispense Bulk Detergent Tank Level

erds.name: Smart Dispense Estimated Loads Remaining
erds.description: Number of Smart Dispense cycles remaining based on detergent level. Signal used internal to the system, do not display to user. Value of 255 indicates unknown number of loads remaining.

erds.name: Bulk Tank Size
erds.description: The size of the Smart Dispense bulk detergent tank in fluid ounces times 10. For models without Smart Dispense the value will be 0. Value of 65535 indicates number of loads unknown.

data.name: Smart Dispense Bulk Tank Size x 10 (ounces)

erds.name: Remote Stop Cycle Request
erds.description:
Write zero to this ERD to stop the currently running, paused, delay run or delay paused cycle.

Depends on:
- ERD 0x2000 must be Run, Pause, Delay Run or Delay Pause
- ERD 0x2039 must be Enabled

ERD 0x2040 is a member of
- API V1 Remote Start and Stop and
- API V2 Remote Start and Stop V2.

API V2 Remote Start and Stop V2 takes precedence.

erds.name: Remote Start Extended Tumble
erds.description:
Write zero to this ERD to start the Extended Tumble part of the current selected cycle.

Depends on
- ERD 0x2000 must be Idle, Standby, or End Of Cycle
- ERD 0x2039 must be Enabled.

API V2 Remote Start and Stop V2 takes precedence.

erds.name: Load Recommended Washer Link Cycle Request
erds.description:
Write 255 to this 0x206A to load the cycle in 0x206B Recommended Washer Link Cycle.
The ERD will reset back to normal automatically after writing.

Depends on
- 0x206C Washer Link Option Selection must be Enabled

0x2096 Load Recommended Washer Link Cycle Request is a member of both
- V1 Washer Link and
- V1 Washer Link 2

erds.name: Recommended Washer Link Cycle
erds.description:
The recommended cycle to run on the dryer based on the information received from the washer in 0x2069 Washer Link Data or 0x2096 Washer Link 2 Data

Depends on
  - 0x2069 Washer Link Data
  - 0x2096 Washer Link 2 Data

0x206B Recommended Washer Link Cycle is a member of both
  - V1 Washer Link and
  - V1 Washer Link 2

erds.name: Washer Link Option Selection
erds.description:
Current Selection for the Washer Link Option

0x206C Washer Link Option Selection is a member of both
- V1 Washer Link and
- V1 Washer Link 2

erds.name: Washer Link Option Request
erds.description:
Use this Erd to request a change of the Washer Link Option.
  - Follows the [Option with Bitmapped Allowables](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_dryer/option_bitmap_allowables.md)

0x206D Washer Link Option Request' is a member of both
  - V1 Washer Link and
  - V1 Washer Link 2

Some units have the WasherLink Option on the cycle knob. In these units:
  - a change in the washer link option can not be requested remotely.
  - the bitmapped allowables linked above will indicate no options can be selected remotely.

erds.name: Washer Link Option Allowables
erds.description:
Bitmap of allowable option selections for the washer link option. If the bit is true, then the given setting is allowed.

0x206E Washer Link Option Allowables is a member of both
- V1 Washer Link and
- V1 Washer Link 2

erds.name: Remote Cycle Selection Request
erds.description:
Erd used to request a cycle to be selected by an appliance.
- After being written, this ERD value is reset to 0xFF.
- If the request is granted, the currently selected cycle is reflected in 0x200A Laundry Current Selected Cycle.

erds.name: Smart Dispense Adjustability Request

erds.name: Flex Dispense Request
erds.description:
The client can request a change to the Flex Dispense Stage and Method settings.
Whether or not the request was accepted, the appliance resets ERD 0x20D5 to 0xFF as an indication the request was 'consumed' and have it ready for the next request.

erds.name: Flex Dispense Current
erds.description: The client can read the current values set for Flex Dispense Stage and Method settings.

erds.name: Downloadable Cycle Feature Version
erds.description:
Feature version of the downloadable cycles

Notes
- https://github.com/geappliances/mobile.brand-content/blob/prd/apps/smarthq/US/en-US/laundry/DownloadedCycles.json,
contains the text descriptions for each downloadable cycle to be used in SmartHQ.
- The version number is the index in the above file to locate the list of cycles and descriptions.

erds.name: Stain Removal Feature Version
erds.description: The feature version shows which platform the stain removal has been configured to. Currently, 0 is reserved and 1 is for TL28 Washer and FLRP2.

erds.name: Flex Dispense Feature Version
erds.description:
Feature version ERD is used to allow diffent bucket mapping across models so a given detergent can be mapped to bucket 3 for feature version 1 while the same detergent can be mapped to bucket 1 for feature version 2.
Clients shall read feature version from appliance and use it as a key to identify the correct mapping according [this](https://github.com/geappliances/mobile.brand-content/blob/prd/apps/smarthq/US/en-US/laundry/SoftenerType.json) configuration.

erds.name: Low Airflow Notification or Warning
erds.description: Low air flow can be caused by the door filter and/or the condenser filter.  Notification set means cycle can continue but user should clear filters.  Warning means cycle cannot start/continue.

values.0: Low airflow is not detected, notification or warning is clear

erds.name: Water Tank Warnings
erds.description: Notifies whether the water tank/multiple tanks being full, empty or neither.  "Tank full" refers to water extracted from clothes filling the tank.  "Tank empty" refers to there being no water to steam the clothes.

data.name: Water Tank Warnings.Extracted water tank full warning is set
Water Tank Warnings.Steam water tank empty warning is set

erds.name: Scent Liquid Cumulative Usage
erds.description: Contains the cumulative amount of scent liquid used over the life of the unit

erds.name: Scent Tank Size
erds.description: The size of the Scent tank in fluid ounces

erds.name: Adaptive My Cycle Option
erds.description: Current selection for the Adaptive My Cycle Option.

erds.name: Adaptive My Cycle Option Request
erds.description:
Use this ERD to request a change of the ERD 0x20F1 Adaptive My Cycle Option.
- Follows the [Option with Bitmapped Allowables](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_dryer/option_bitmap_allowables.md)

Depends on
- 0x2000 Machine State must not be Idle or Commissioning.

erds.name: Adaptive My Cycle Option Allowables
erds.description: Bitmap of allowable option selections for the adaptive my cycle option. If the bit is true, then the given setting is allowed.

data.name: AdaptiveMyCycleOptionAllowables.Adaptive My Cycle Option Disable Allowed
AdaptiveMyCycleOptionAllowables.Adaptive My Cycle Option Enable Allowed

erds.name: Self Clean Reminder Signal
erds.description:
When the number of performed cycles reaches target cycle count, it sends notification to the app from the
device. Signal becomes true when number of consecutive washer cycles is reached without a self clean.

erds.name: Smart Vent Stop Reason
erds.description:
Indicates stop reason for Smart Vent.
- None = Smart Vent has not stopped yet
- Success = Smart Vent has ended successfully and has returned a result
- Cycle Canceled = Smart Vent cycle was cancelled while running
- Option Disabled = Smart Vent became disabled while running
- Slope Out Of Range = Measurement of the temperature slope fell out of bounds during the test
- Temperature Adjustment Time Out = Smart Vent took too long to set the temperature at the beginning of the test

erds.name: Timed Cycle Total Duration Option Request
erds.description:
This ERD requests a change in 0x211F Timed Cycle Total Duration Option Current

Notes:
- The field IsRequested will be set to false after the request is processed.
- If the request is granted, the value will be reflected in 0x211F Timed Cycle Total Duration Option Current

Depends on:
- 0x201C Dryer Cycle Type must be Timed Dry
- 0x2000 Machine State must not be Idle or Commissioning
- 0x2001 MachineSubCycle must not be CoolDown (130) or ExtendedTumble (131)

erds.name: Washer and Dryer Combi Push Notifications
erds.description:
Byte 0 & 1: Individual bits to be controlled by the firmware when a push notification needs to be sent.
            Critical for the firmware to only set a bit at a time to avoid sending multiple push notifications.
            All bits must be cleared at the beginning of a cycle.
Byte 2 & 3: Notification Allowable bits. If a specific feature bit is set to zero, the notification for that feature is NOT supported for a given platform.

erds.description: ERD to indicate the dryer heater type.

erds.name: Cycle Pricing Request
erds.description:
This erd requests a change to the cycle pricing menu.
Upon each request, the portal will populate each entry and use CycleSelected_NotDefined for entries that are not used.

erds.name: Cycle Pricing Status
erds.description:
This erd is the status of the cycle pricing menu.
The status will populate unused entries with CycleSelected_NotDefined.

erds.name: Option Pricing Request
erds.description:
This erd requests a change to the option pricing menu.
Upon each request, the portal will populate each entry and use OptionId_DontCare (0xFF) for entries that are not used.
Available options and their available levels will be exposed in 0x209E.
Both washer and dryer have two separate enumerations for OptionId. And so, the portal will use ApplianceType to determine which enumeration to use.

erds.name: Option Pricing Status
erds.description:
This erd is the status of the option pricing menu.
The status will populate unused entries with OptionId_DontCare (0xFF).
Available options and their available levels will be exposed in 0x209E.
Both washer and dryer have two separate enumerations for OptionId. And so, the portal will use ApplianceType to determine which enumeration to use.

erds.name: Mid-Cycle Adjustment Pricing Request
erds.description:
This erd requests a change to the Mid-Cycle Adjustment pricing menu.
Upon each request, the portal will populate each entry and use MidCycleAdjustment_NotDefined for entries that are not used.

erds.name: Mid-Cycle Adjustment Pricing Status
erds.description:
This erd is the status of the Mid-Cycle Adjustment pricing menu.
The status will populate unused entries with MidCycleAdjustment_NotDefined.

erds.name: Smart Combi Option Status
erds.description:
When laundry center enables this option, it will automatically select a dryer cycle and
will run the cycle to preheat the dryer before the washer completes the wash cycle.

As a user, I want the correct dryer settings to automatically be set based on my wash selection,
when I want to wash and dry a load. So that I do not have to manually set it twice.

erds.name: Smart Combi Option Request
erds.description: Use this ERD to request a change of ERD 0x216E smart combi option.

erds.name: Laundry Center Push Notifications
erds.description:
Byte 0, 1, 2 & 3: Individual bits to be controlled by the firmware when a push notification needs to be sent.
            Critical for the firmware to only set one bit at a time to avoid sending multiple push notifications.
            All bits must be cleared at the beginning of a cycle.
Byte 4, 5, 6 & 7: Notification Allowable bits. If a specific feature bit is set to zero, the notification for that feature is NOT supported for a given platform.

data.name: Self Clean Cycle Reminder Notification Supported

erds.name: Reset Current Coin Box Count Request
erds.description:
This erd requests a change to the coin box coin count.
Upon request, the device will clear the coins counted since last opening reported in 0x216A.
The device shall write the value of this ERD to request consumed once the coin count has been reset.

erds.name: Delay Start Status
erds.description:
This ERD reports the current status of Delay Start

Notes:
- Delay Duration Minutes will be counted down and updated every minute when field IsEnabled is true.
- When field Delay Duration Minutes reaches 0, delay started cycle will run.

erds.name: Delay Start Duration Request
erds.description:
Use this ERD to request a change of the ERD 0x217F Delay Start Status

Notes:
- The field RequestedState requests to Disable (false) or Enable (true) the feature.
- The field IsRequested should be set to true to request a delay start.
- The field IsRequested is set to false after the request is processed.
- If the request is granted, the value will be reflected in 0x217F Delay Start Status.

data.name: Delay Start Duration Request In Minutes

erds.name: Delay Start Duration Allowable
erds.description:
Range of allowable values for Delay Start

Notes:
- If field IsAllowed is true, a value in the range of min and max is allowed for DelayDurationMinutes of 0x2180 Delay Start Request.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Machine State
erds.description: The current state of the laundry machine's additional cavity.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Sub Cycle State
erds.description: The current sub-cycle of the laundry machine additional cavity.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Remaining Cycle Time
erds.description:
The amount of time in seconds remaining before the laundry additional cavity cycle completes.

Depends on
- 0x2200 Machine State Must be Run.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Laundry Current Selected Cycle
erds.description: The currently selected cycle of the additional cavity of the laundry machine.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Delay Time Remaining Minutes
erds.description:
The amount of delay time remaining in minutes for laundry machine additional cavity.

Depends On
- 0x2200 Machine State must be DelayRun or DelayPause.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Lid Switch State
erds.description: Current state of the additional cavity door/lid'

erds.name: Additional Cavity Remote Set Delay Start Minutes
erds.description:
Write this ERD to set the delay start time in minutes or start the delay start for laundry machine additional cavity
- 0 through 1440 inclusive are allowed values.
- 0 will start the delay start cycle immediately.

Depends on:
- ERD 0x2200 must be delay run or delay pause.
- ERD 0x2207 must be enabled

Read
- 0xFFFF = Request processed

erds.name: Additional Cavity Remote Status
erds.description: Indicates if an additional cavity cycle can be controlled remotely.

values.255: Model does not support remote operation

erds.name: Additional Cavity Remote Stop Cycle Request
erds.description:
Write zero to this ERD to stop the currently running, paused, delay run or delay paused additional cavity cycle.

Depends on:
- ERD 0x2200 must be run, pause, delay run or delay pause.
- ERD 0x2207 must be enabled.

erds.name: Additional Cavity Remote Cycle Selection Request
erds.description: ERD used to request a cycle to be selected by an appliances. After being written, this ERD's value is reset to 0xFF and the currently selected cycle is reflected in 0x2203.

erds.name: Washer Push Notifications
erds.description:
Byte 0, 1, 2 & 3: Individual bits to be controlled by the firmware when a push notification needs to be sent.
                  All bits must be cleared at the beginning of a cycle.
Byte 4, 5, 6 & 7: Notification Supported bits. If a specific feature bit is set to zero, the notification for that feature is NOT supported for a given platform.

data.name: Water Level Too High Notification Supported

erds.name: Laundry Appliance Fault Push Notifications
erds.description:
Laundry appliance fault notifications occur when a critical fault is active. When a critical fault is active all cycles will be prevented from starting or running.
Byte 0 & 1: Individual bits to be controlled by the firmware when a push notification needs to be sent.
Byte 2 & 3: Notification Supported bits. If a specific feature bit is set to zero, the notification for that feature is NOT supported for a given platform.

erds.name: Flexible Dispensing Tank 1 Configuration Status
erds.description: Current configuration (liquid type and dose) of dispensing tanks.

erds.name: Flexible Dispensing Tank 1 Configuration Request
erds.description: Sets current configuration (liquid type and dose) of dispensing tanks.

erds.name: Flexible Dispensing Tank 2 Configuration Status
erds.description: Current configuration (liquid type and dose) of dispensing tanks.

erds.name: Flexible Dispensing Tank 2 Configuration Request
erds.description: Sets current configuration (liquid type and dose) of dispensing tanks.

erds.name: Pet Hair Removal Option
erds.description: This feature reads the actual Pet Hair Removal Option value.

erds.name: Pet Hair Removal Option Request
erds.description:
This ERD requests a change in the Pet Hair Removal Option.
- After being written, this ERD value is reset to 0xFF.
- If the request is granted, the current Pet Hair Removal Option is reflected in 0x2230.

erds.name: Pet Hair Removal Option Is In Client Writable State
erds.description: Indicates if the Pet Hair Removal Option can be written once the cycle is running.

data.name: Pet Hair Removal Option Is Client Writable State

erds.name: Flexible Dispensing Tank 1 Level
erds.description: Liquid level of dispensing tank

erds.name: Flexible Dispensing Tank 2 Level
erds.description: Liquid level of dispensing tank

erds.name: Diagnostic Failure counts
erds.description:
Diagnostic counters, for failure (pre-fault) conditions.

The various conditions will change the heating method for the current heating cycle
when the failure is set, and at the end of the cycle, the failure is cleared and the
specific counter is incremented.

If a failure does not occur on the next cycle, the counter associated is decremented.

Once the counter hits the target (generally 5 cycles) the fault is triggered.

erds.name: Accent Lighting Request
erds.description:
Settings related to product accent lighting.
- Custom Color Active - sets whether the custom color code should be used.  When true, the custom color will override the color temperature.
- Brightness - Sets the brightness of both knob backlights and tasklights.  This should be between the min/max in ERD 0x5025.
- Temperature - Sets the color temperature (warmer/cooler).  This should be between the min/max in ERD 0x5025.
- Custom Color Code - Sets a custom accent color.  Only used if ERD 0x5025 indicates custom color is available and Custom Color Active is true.

erds.name: Accent Lighting Status
erds.description: Current accent lighting settings.

erds.name: Accent Lighting Supported Settings
erds.description: Indicates what lighting settings are available

erds.name: Air Fry Oven Minimum and Maximum Temperatures
erds.description: The minimum and maximum values that can be set for Air Fry.

erds.name: Articulating Display Mode
erds.description:
The mode of articulation for the Articulating UI Screen.
This UI screen rotates out from the range so that the user has a good viewing angle.
Auto Mode means that the UI articulates automatically when the user turns on the cooktop.
Manual means that the UI articulates whenever a button is pressed to extend or retract.

erds.name: Articulating Display Mode Request
erds.description:
The client desired mode of articulation for the Articulating UI Screen.
This UI screen rotates out from the range so that the user has a good viewing angle.
Auto Mode means that the UI articulates automatically when the user turns on the cooktop.
Manual means that the UI articulates whenever a button is pressed to extend or retract.

erds.name: Articulating Display Position
erds.description:
The actual orientation of the Articulating UI Screen.
This UI screen rotates out from the range so that the user has a good viewing angle.
Extended means that the screen is rotated out.
Retracted means that the screen is flush with the range chassis.

erds.name: Articulating Display Position Request
erds.description:
The client desired orientation of the Articulating UI Screen.
This UI screen rotates out from the range so that the user has a good viewing angle.
To Extend is to rotate out the screen.
To retract is to make the screen be flush with the range chassis.

erds.name: Enhanced Sabbath State

erds.name: Enhanced Sabbath Cooking Accepted Request
erds.description:
This ERD is used to accept/cancel an Enhanced Sabbath/Holiday cook mode, given the current Enhanced Sabbath State (ERD 0x502E).

1. To to accept the cooking prompt, set this ERD to true while the State is 'Prompt Sabbath' (1) or 'Prompt Holiday' (2). (State will become 'Cooking Accepted, Sabbath Pending' (3) or 'Cooking Accepted, Holiday Pending' (4), respectively.)

2. To revoke acceptance, set this ERD to false while the the State is 'Cooking Accepted, Sabbath Pending' (3) or 'Cooking Accepted, Holiday Pending' (4). (State will revert to 'Prompt Sabbath' (1) or 'Prompt Holiday' (2), respectively.)

3. To cancel an active Sabbath/Holiday cook mode, set this ERD to false while the the State is 'Sabbath Active, Warm' (7), 'Holiday Active, Warm' (8), or 'Holiday Active, Bake' (9). (State will become 'Sabbath Active, No Cooking' (5) or 'Holiday Active, No Cooking' (6), resepctively.)

The client is responsible for resetting this ERD to false after the Sabbath/Holiday period ends.

See status ERD 0x5030.

erds.name: Enhanced Sabbath Cooking Accepted Status
erds.description:
The current state of whether Enhanced Sabbath cooking has been accepted.

See request ERD 0x502F.

erds.name: Enhanced Sabbath Warmness Setting Request

erds.name: Enhanced Sabbath Warmness Setting Status

erds.name: Enhanced Shabbos Keeper Is Connected Status

erds.name: Cook Cam AI Assistant Enabled Request

erds.name: Cook Cam AI Assistant Enabled Status

a state change can be requested by writing to the request ERD 0x504E.

See ERD 0x504E for the Cook Cam AI Assistant Enabled Request.

erds.name: AI Bake Cloud Status
erds.description: The status of the active AI session on the cloud to the unit. Food Type is an NULL terminated string of the name of the food identified. Invalid in the Valid Doneness Levels should always be true. See https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.ai-bake

erds.description:
The user stage of the current cook including the stage number and a bitmap of conditions required to advance to the next stage. A bitmap of `0` indicates that the stage will automatically advance.

Note: this is the stage reflected to the UI/user, it is not indicitive of the actual "stage" of the cook engine.

erds.name: Lower Cavity Current Cycle Stage
erds.description:
The user stage of the current cook including the stage number and a bitmap of conditions required to advance to the next stage. A bitmap of `0` indicates that the stage will automatically advance.

Note: this is the stage reflected to the UI/user, it is not indicitive of the actual "stage" of the cook engine.

erds.name: Lower Oven Advance Cook Stage
erds.description: This signal is intended to be incremented by clients to indicate the user has met conditions to advance the stage of a user interactive precision cook.

erds.name: Recipe Status
erds.description:
Indicates the status of a running recipe on the system.

Note: the control only stores this data, it does not do anything with it.

erds.name: Advantium Remote Cook Mode Configuration
erds.description:
Use this ERD to determine, which cook modes are available remotely, and which options they support.

Note
- The `Available` option determine whether a mode is shown to the user.
- For all options except `Available` an enabled means client can modify the related data.
- If `Convection on time` of the `Precision Cook Custom` is not set then the unit is 120v.

| Option   | Exceptions |
| ----------------- | -------------------------- |
| Remote Control | If disabled the user can not modify the cook mode |
| Upper heaters on time | If disabled do not show. |
| Lower heaters on time | If disabled do not show. |
| Microwave on time | If disabled do not show. |
| Convection on time | If disabled do not show. |

erds.name: Advantium Cook Status
erds.description:
Current Cook Status.
 - The `Remote Request ID` is the same as the originating cook request.
 - See 0x5402 for the rules regarding `Remote Cook Request IDs`

erds.name: Advantium Cook Request
erds.description:
ERD used to request a cook from the client.
- The `Remote Cook Request ID` is an ID generated by the requesting client. The only stipulation on the ID is that it must be different from the previous.
- If a cooking element isn't needed for a cook then the client should send 0 for that element. Ex. A convection bake will set the cook temperature to 350 and microwave power, upper element, lower element, and convection element to 0.

Depends on
- The requested cook mode should follow the constraint defined in 0x5400

erds.name: Advantium Cook Time Remaining
erds.description: Remaining cook time.

erds.name: Advantium Cook Time Adjustment
erds.description:
Adjustment to the current cook time.
- Ex. +30s, -5s, etc.

Depends on
- The `Cook Action` of 0x5401 and 0x5402 should not be `Stop`.
- The `Cook time adjustable` of 0x5403 should be `Adjustable`.
- The cook time after adjustment should be between the minimum and max of the cook mode in either 0x5407, 0x5408, or 0x5409

erds.name: Advantium Menu Tree Parametric Hash
erds.description:
SHA-256 Hash of the menu tree parametric data
- Should be requested before showing the device's precision cooking cycles

erds.name: Advantium Menu Tree Selection
erds.description:
Advantium's menu tree item selection for remote invocation.

Note
- Client needs to download the related menu tree
- The tree menu can be requested with `GET v1/file/sha256/{hash}`

Depends on
- 0x5405 the hash used to request the menu tree

erds.name: Advantium Allowable Oven Cook Time
erds.description:
The minimum and maximum allowable cook time for oven cook modes.

Note
- User should not be able to set higher than the max value.
- The start button should be disabled until the min is reached.

erds.name: Advantium Remote JSON Cook Request
erds.description:
ERD used to request a cook from the client.
- The `Remote Cook Request ID` is an ID generated by the requesting client. The only stipulation on the ID is that it must be different from the previous.
- If a cooking element isn't needed for a cook then the client should send 0 for that element. Ex. A convection bake will set the cook temperature to 350 and microwave power, upper element, lower element, and convection element to 0.
- Client should parse the platform json and set the recipe id / choice selections / remote menu item selected if they want the UI to match the precision recipe.
- Setting remote menu item selected to false will make the UI treat it as a generic cook request

Depends on
- The requested cook mode should follow the constraint defined in 0x5400
- The correct json file being uploaded with a hash matchin 0x5405

erds.name: Left Front Closed-Loop Cooking Configuration
erds.description:
The closed loop cooking configuration parameters for the left front burner.

Writing to this ERD is only allowed if:
- The ERD 0x5771 'Primary Devices Status' has one of the following values
  - 'Device selected' (2)
  - 'Device selected and in local closed-loop control (editable)' (4)
  - 'Device selected and in remote closed-loop control' (5),
- The 'Target Temperature' is between the 'Minimum Settable Temperature' and 'Maximum Settable Temperature' given by ERD 0x5771

Set PID terms to 0xFF's if not adjusting.

erds.name: Left Rear Closed-Loop Cooking Configuration
erds.description:

  - 'Device selected and in remote closed-loop control' (5),
- The 'Target Temperature' is between the 'Minimum Settable Temperature' and 'Maximum Settable Temperature' given by ERD 0x5772

Set PID terms to 0xFF's if not adjusting.

erds.name: Hood Fan Speed
erds.description: The current active fan speed. When writing, fan speed must be listed as available in available fan speed ERD 0x5B01.

erds.name: Hood Fan Speed Availability
erds.description: The availability of fan speeds.

erds.name: Hood Light Level
erds.description: The current light setting. When writing, level must be listed as available in available light levels ERD 0x5B03. If 0x5B03 has "Infinite" set, then the Light Level is % with max 100.

erds.name: Hood Light Level Availability
erds.description: The availability of light levels.

erds.name: Hood Delay Off
erds.description: This activates the Delay Off if the unit is On. It can also be used to cancel a pending delay off.

erds.name: Hood Delay On
erds.description: This activates the Delay On if the unit is Off. It can also be used to cancel a pending delay on.

erds.name: Hood Heat Sensor Temperature
erds.description: This indicates the heat sensor temperature on a vent hood.

erds.name: Hood Heat Sensor State
erds.description: This indicates the heat sensor state on a vent hood.

erds.name: Hood Camera Light Assist Level
erds.description: The current camera light assist setting. When writing, level must be listed as available in available light levels ERD 0x5B09. If 0x5B09 has "Infinite" set, then the Light Level is % with max 100.

erds.name: Hood Camera Light Assist Level Availability
erds.description: The availability of the hood camera light assist levels.

erds.name: Hood Display Protection Fan Speed
erds.description: The current active hood display protection fan speed. When writing, fan speed must be listed as available in available fan speed ERD 0x5B0B.

erds.name: Hood Display Protection Fan Speed Availability
erds.description: The availability of fan speeds.

erds.name: Hood Notifications
erds.description: Notifications from a hood.

erds.name: Hood Notification Reset
erds.description: Reset notifications set in 0x5B0C. Any time a 1 is written to these bits the associated notification is cleared. The host is expected to accept multiple writes with the same data.

erds.name: Boost Duration
erds.description: The length of time (in minutes) a Boost Fan will run. See ERD 0x5B00. See 0x5B10 for limits.

erds.name: Delay Off Duration
erds.description: The length of time (in minutes) a for delay off will run. See ERD 0x5B04 . See 0x5B11 for limits.

erds.name: Boost Duration Limits
erds.description: The acceptable limits (in minutes) for Boost Duration (see ERD 0x5B0E). Min must be less than max.

erds.name: Delay Off Duration Limits
erds.description: The acceptable limits (in minutes) for Delay Off (see ERD 0x5B0F). Min must be less than max.

erds.name: Hood Request On/Off
erds.description: This request turns the hood on to product-specific default light/fan settings. When turning the hood off, the product might save the previously used fan/light settings.

erds.name: Hood Actual Fan Speed
erds.description: Current Fan Speed (0 = OFF to X = Max Speed, inc. Boost, as in Available Fan Speeds (ERD 0x5B15))

erds.name: Hood Requested Fan Speed
erds.description: Requested Fan Speed (0 = OFF to X = Max Speed, inc. Boost, as in Available Fan Speeds (ERD 0x5B15))

erds.name: Hood Available Fan Speeds
erds.description: Available Fan Speeds (includes Available Boost Speeds as in ERD 0x5B16). Example: Normal Speeds = 3, Boost Speeds (ERD 0x5B16) = 2, Available Fan Speeds (ERD 0x5B15)= 5

erds.name: Hood Available Boost Speeds
erds.description: Available Boost Speeds (0 = no boost available). Boost Speeds are included in Available Fan Speeds ERD 0x5B15

erds.name: Hood Actual Light Level
erds.description: Current Light Level (0 = OFF to X = Max Light Level as in ERD 0x5B19)

erds.name: Hood Requested Light Level
erds.description: Requested Light Level (0 = OFF to X = Max Light Level as in ERD 0x5B19)

erds.name: Hood Available Light Levels
erds.description: Available Light Levels (0 = hood has no light)

erds.name: Hood Actual Delay Off Mode
erds.description: Indicates whether the hood is in Delay Off Mode

erds.name: Hood Delay Off Request
erds.description: A request to start or stop the Delay Off Mode

erds.name: Hood Actual Delay Off Duration
erds.description: The set duration of the Delay Off mode in minutes. See ERD 0x5B11 for limits.

erds.name: Hood Requested Delay Off Duration
erds.description: Request to set a duration in minutes for the Delay Off mode. See ERD 0x5B11 for limits.

erds.name: Hood to Cooktop Connection Status (Hood-Side)
erds.description: Indicates the Status of the Hood to Cooktop (Chef Connect) Connection

erds.name: Hood Status
erds.description: Status of the hood

erds.name: Hood Model
erds.description: Range Hood Model. First byte specifies Manufacturer/Model. Second byte specifies personality, if available/used.

erds.name: Hood Actual Light Color
erds.description: The currently set Light Color.

erds.name: Hood Requested Light Color
erds.description: Request to set the Light Color.

erds.name: Hood Available Light Colors
erds.description: The Light Colors this hood supports

erds.name: Hood to Hob Actual Auto Control
erds.description: Current State of Auto Fan Speed Control. Any change in speed not coming through ERD 0x5B26 will set this state to "Off".

erds.name: Hood to Hob Request Auto Control
erds.description: Request for Auto Control of fan speed. Auto Control of fan speed has to be done through ERD 0x5B26.

erds.name: Hood Requested Auto Fan Speed
erds.description: Requested Fan Speed (0 = OFF to X = Max Speed, inc. Boost, as in Available Fan Speeds (ERD 0x5B15)). Requests on this ERD are only processed when ERD 0x5B24/0x5B25 set to "Auto". This ERD is only to be used from a Hob (Auto Control).

erds.name: Relative Humidity Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed relative humidity ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B28.

erds.name: Requested Relative Humidity Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed relative humidity ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of Relative Humidity (%)
erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device relative humidity ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B2A will be updated

erds.name: Relative Humidity (%)
erds.description: The sensed relative humidity in percent, evaluated air quality, and sensor state. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B27, and can be changed with 0x5B28.

erds.name: VOC Index Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed VOC index ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B2C.

erds.name: Requested VOC Index Sensor Update Idle Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed VOC index ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of VOC Index
erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device VOC index ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B2E will be updated

erds.name: VOC Index
erds.description: The sensed Volatile Organic Compounds Index from 1 to 500, evaluated air quality, and sensor state. A value of 100 represents the average VOC presence in the last 24 hrs. Value > 100 represents VOCs are more intense than usual. If value remains elevated for 3 hours, then the sensor will adapt the VOC levels to be part of the background VOC. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B2B, and can be changed with 0x5B2C.

erds.name: PM 2.5 Update Idle Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed PM 2.5 ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B30.

erds.name: Requested PM 2.5 Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed PM 2.5 ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of PM 2.5 (ug/m^3)
erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device PM 2.5 ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B32 will be updated

erds.name: PM 2.5 (ug/m^3)
erds.description: The sensed PM 2.5 in ug/m^3, evaluated air quality and sensor state. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B2F, and can be changed with 0x5B30.

erds.name: NOx Index Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed NOx ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B34.

erds.name: Requested NOx Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed NOx ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of NOx Index
erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device NOx index ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B36 will be updated

erds.name: NOx Index
erds.description: The sensed Nitrous Oxide index from 1 to 500, evaluated air quality, and sensor state. A value of 1 represents the average NOx presence in the last 24 hrs. Values > 1 represents NOx presences. If value remains elevated for 3 hours, then the sensor will adapt the VOC levels to be part of the background VOC. The update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B33, and can be changed with 0x5B34.

erds.name: PM 1 Update Idle Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed PM 1 ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B38.

erds.name: Requested PM 1 Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed PM 1 ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device PM 1 ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B3A will be updated

erds.name: PM 1 (ug/m^3)
erds.description: The sensed PM 1 in ug/m^3, evaluated air quality and sensor state. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B37, and can be changed with 0x5B38.

erds.name: PM 4 Update Idle Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed PM 4 ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B3C.

erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed PM 4 ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Hood Notifications V2
erds.description: List of version 2 hood notifications.

erds.name: PM 4 (ug/m^3)
erds.description: The sensed PM 4 in ug/m^3, evaluated air quality, and sensor state. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B3B, and can be changed with 0x5B3C.

erds.name: PM 10 Update Idle Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed PM 10 ERD, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B41.

erds.name: Requested PM 10 Sensor Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed PM 10 ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: PM 10 (ug/m^3)
erds.description: The sensed PM 10 in ug/m^3, the evaluated air quality, and sensor state. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B40, and can be changed with 0x5B41.

erds.name: Environmental Temperature Update Idle Period in Minutes
erds.description: The reported update period of the sensed Environmental Temperature, while idle. The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B45.

erds.name: Requested Environmental Temperature Idle Update Period in Minutes
erds.description: The requested update period of the sensed Environmental Temperature ERD, while idle. The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of Environmental Temperature (F)
erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device Environmental temperature ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B47 will be updated

erds.name: Environmental Temperature
erds.description: The sensed Environmental Temperature in Fahrenheit, evaluated air quality, and sensor state. The idle update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B44, and can be changed with 0x5B45.

erds.name: Supported Hood Notifications V2
erds.description: List of supported notifications from a hood.

erds.name: Air Filter Fan Run Time
erds.description: The total run time of the hood air filter fan in minutes. This value can be reset using 0x5B0D.

erds.name: Charcoal Filter Fan Run Time
erds.description: The total run time of the hood charcoal filter fan in minutes. This value can be reset using 0x5B0D.

erds.name: Overall Air Quality
erds.description: The device overall resolved air quality. This ERD will not change more than once per minute.

erds.name: Available Color Schemes
erds.description: The available color schemes on the device.

erds.name: Selected Color Scheme
erds.description: The current color scheme used by the device.

erds.name: Requested Color Scheme
erds.description: Initiates a request to change to the desired color scheme. This changes the value in 0x5B4D. The device should support the requested scheme from 0x5B4C.

erds.name: PM 2.5 Index Update Period in Minutes
erds.description:
The PM 2.5 Index ERD is expected to report at least once during this period.
The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B50.

erds.name: Requested PM 2.5 Index Sensor Update Period in Minutes
erds.description:
The requested change to the update period of the sensed PM 2.5 Index ERD.
The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of PM 2.5 Index
erds.description:
Used to request an update to the device PM 2.5 Index ERD.
 - After being written to the device value will change its value to "No Request"(0).
 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B52 will be updated

erds.name: PM 2.5 Index
erds.description:
The sensed PM 2.5 as a relative value, the evaluated air quality, and sensor state.
The relative value is defined as 0-100, where 0 means no or minimal presence and 100 means maximum presence.
The maximum update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B4F, and can be changed with 0x5B50.

erds.name: PM 1 Index Update Period in Minutes
erds.description:
The PM 1 Index ERD is expected to report at least once during this period.
The device can report more often than this number of minutes if something interesting is occurring (e.g. the fan is on). The value of this is determined from 0x5B54.

erds.name: Requested PM 1 Index Sensor Update Period in Minutes
erds.description:

The fastest requested period should be 1 minute.

erds.name: Request Update of PM 1 Index
erds.description:

 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B56 will be updated

erds.name: PM 1 Index
erds.description:
The sensed PM 1 as a relative value, the evaluated air quality, and sensor state.
The relative value is defined as 0-100, where 0 means no or minimal presence and 100 means maximum presence.
The maximum update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B53, and can be changed with 0x5B54.
