 - If the device receives the request then the value of 0x5B5E will be updated

erds.name: PM 10 Index
erds.description:
The sensed PM 10 as a relative value, the evaluated air quality, and sensor state.
The relative value is defined as 0-100, where 0 means no or minimal presence and 100 means maximum presence.
The maximum update period for this ERD is reported in 0x5B5B, and can be changed with 0x5B5C.

erds.name: Microwave Timed Mode Current Setting
erds.description: ERD must specify the time (in minutes and seconds) and power level (1-10) of the operation.  If the unit is also to start, ERD 0x5C11 must be set subsequent to this one.  The microwave is responsible to clear any previously set modes when it receives this mode.  If this mode is not set than time should be set to 00 minutes 00 seconds and power level should be 0.  The time, is the time at start.  It should not change once the mode is started.  All active cook time notifications should come from 0x5C15.

erds.name: Available Microwave Modes
erds.description: List of available modes on the microwave.

erds.name: Microwave Popcorn Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Popcorn Mode. All values are in ounce (oz).

erds.name: Microwave Popcorn Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Popcorn mode measured in ounces (oz).

erds.name: Microwave Potato Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Potato Mode (count/each). If bit is set it will indicate that the sub menu is available. Otherwise, bit should be 0. Ex, if "1 potato" bit is set then the potato mode supports 1 potato in the potato sub menu.

erds.name: Microwave Potato Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Potato.

erds.name: Microwave Beverage Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Beverage Mode (Units in cups). If bit is set it will indicate that the sub menu is available. Otherwise, bit should be 0. Ex. if bit 2 and 3 are set, the Beverage Mode supports 1 cup and 2 cups as sub menu settings.

erds.name: Microwave Beverage Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Beverage mode. Units are in cups.

erds.name: Microwave Pizza Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Pizza Mode (Units in slices).If bit is set it will indicate that the sub menu is available. Otherwise, bit should be 0. Ex. if bit 2 and 3 are set, the Pizza Mode supports 1 slice and 3 slices as in the sub menu.

erds.name: Microwave Pizza Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Pizza mode. Measured in slices.

erds.name: Microwave Frozen Vegetable Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Frozen Vegetable Mode. Units in cups.

erds.name: Microwave Frozen Vegetable Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Frozen Vegetable mode. Measured in cups.

erds.name: Microwave Fresh Vegetable Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Fresh/Canned Vegetable Mode. Units in cups.

erds.name: Microwave Fresh Vegetable Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Fresh/Canned Vegetable mode. Measured in cups.

erds.name: Microwave Reheat Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Reheat Mode.

erds.name: Microwave Reheat Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Reheat mode.

erds.name: Microwave Add 30 Second Command
erds.description: Allows to send a command to microwave to add 30 seconds. The sequence number is a randomly generated number that is sent with each Write.

erds.name: Microwave State
erds.description: Current Microwave state.  If microwave state is set to "On" or "Paused" the microwave should ignore any requests to change the cycle.  Since the door state cannot be set from the cloud, FF should be placed into the door state whenever written from the cloud/app to the microwave to indicate that the state cannot be changed.  Only 1 mode is ever allowed to be set on the microwave.  If subsequent mode commands (such as 0x5c03 followed by 0x5c05) are sent, the microwave is responsible to make sure that only the latest received mode command is recognized and reported as active.

erds.name: Microwave Power in Watts
erds.description: Current microwave power level in watts

erds.name: Microwave Time after Cycle End
erds.description: The time in minutes after cooking cycle ends and before the door has been opened. Timer resets when door is opened.

erds.name: Microwave Remote Enable
erds.description: Microwave Remote Enable.

erds.name: Microwave Cook Timer
erds.description: The number of minutes and seconds remaining for the cook timer.  This should be the only cook timer that decrements once a cooking/defrost/popcorn/... cycle begins.  All other microwave cook mode times (such as those in 0x5c00 and 0x5C17) are only initial cook times, not current cook time.

erds.name: Microwave Defrost by Weight - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Defrost by Weight mode. Weight is multiplied by 10 to ensure value is integer

erds.name: Microwave Defrost by Time Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Defrost by Time mode is set in minutes and seconds. ERD must specify the time (in minutes and seconds) and power level (1-10) of the operation.  If the unit is also to start, ERD 0x5C11 must be set subsequent to this one.  The microwave is responsible to clear any previously set modes when it receives this mode.  If this mode is not set than time should be set to 00 minutes 00 seconds and power level should be 0.  The time, is the time at start.  It should not change once the mode is started.  All active cook time notifications should come from 0x5C15.

erds.name: Microwave Notifications
erds.description: Current Notifications from Microwave. If the bit is set, the notification is active on the unit.

data.name: Check for doneness & add toppings Notification
Check for doneness. Turn food over before resuming. Notification
Stir food & check for doneness Notification

erds.name: Microwave Kitchen/Display Timer
erds.description: The number of minutes and seconds remaining for the timer on the user interface.  Once the timer has went to 0 min 0 sec, "timer expired" should be set, by setting Expiry notification for Microwave Kitchen Timer in ERD 0x5020 .

erds.name: Microwave Cycle Setting Modification Availability
erds.description: If the bit is 1, the particular setting can be changed. Unit must set the bit to 0 if the particular setting can no longer be modified during a cycle.

erds.name: Microwave Cook Timer Modification
erds.description: Send an arbitrary cook time to be added or subtracted from the current cook time. Sequence Number is a random number generated by the client and allows microwave to detect that a new request is sent.

erds.name: Microwave Dinner Plate Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available settings for Dinner Plate Mode.

erds.name: Microwave Dinner Plate Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO dinner plate Mode.  If not set, it should read FF.

erds.name: Microwave Kitchen Timer Modification
erds.description: Send an arbitrary Kitchen Timer time to be added or subtracted from the current Kitchen timer. Sequence Number is a random number generated by the client and allows microwave to detect that a new request is sent.

data.name: Add or Subtract Kitchen Timer Time

erds.name: Microwave Defrost by Weight - Maximum Allowed Setting
erds.description: Maximum weight allowed for Defrost by Weight mode. Weight is multiplied by 10 to ensure value is integer.

erds.name: Microwave Warm Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available settings for MWO Warm Mode.

erds.name: Microwave Warm Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO warm feature.  If not set, it should read FF.

erds.name: Microwave Auto Defrost Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available settings for Auto Defrost.  The max weight setting for all items is set by ERD 0x5C20.

erds.name: Microwave Auto Defrost Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO Auto defrost Mode.  If not set, it should read FF.

erds.name: Microwave Broil Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available settings for Broil Mode.

erds.name: Microwave Broil Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO broil feature.  If not set, it should read FF.

erds.name: Microwave Auto Bake - Available Settings
erds.description: Defines the min and max range for each of the available food types.

erds.name: Microwave Auto Bake Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO auto bake feature.  If not set, it should read FF.

erds.name: Microwave Auto Roast - Available Settings
erds.description: The min and max weights available for each of the proteins in lbsx10.  00 in both min/max bytes means mode not supported by microwave.

erds.name: Microwave Auto Roast Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO auto roast feature.  If not set, it should read FF.

erds.name: Microwave Oven Cook Timer
erds.description: Cook timer associated with oven based cook modes on convection microwaves

erds.name: Microwave Protein Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: Details which proteins are supported and the associated minimum and maximum weights that are supported by the mode.

erds.name: Microwave Oven Temperature Range
erds.description: Minimum and maximum temperature ranges for all oven based modes that are set by temperature.

erds.name: Microwave Protein Mode - Current Setting
erds.description:
Current setting for Protein mode.
Must set the type of protein and the weight of that item in lbs x 10.
A value of 0x0 for the weight is considered a sensor cook for that protein type.

erds.name: Microwave Broil With Time Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available settings for Broil With Time Mode.  Broil with Time Mode requires a cook timer (0x5C2B) to also be set in conjunction with Broil with Time mode.

erds.name: Microwave Broil With Time Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for the MWO broil with Time feature.  If not set, it should read FF.

data.name: Broil With Time Mode Current Setting

erds.name: Turntable Setting
erds.description: The current setting of the turntable.  If MWO supports turntable on/off is defined in 0x5C01.

erds.name: Microwave Melt Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Melt Mode.

erds.name: Microwave Melt Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Melt mode. Must set the type of food and the amount of that item in integer ounces.

erds.name: Microwave Steam Cook Mode - Available Settings
erds.description: List of available sub menus for the Steam Cook Mode.

erds.name: Microwave Steam Cook Mode - Current Setting
erds.description: Current setting for Steam Cook mode. Must set the type of food and the amount of that item in cups.

erds.name: Staged Microwave Data Uid
erds.description: This identifies the cavity parameters as single id for remote requests to 0x5C3D. A value of 0 should be considered invalid.

erds.name: Staged Microwave Cook Request
erds.description:
Requests a staged microwaved cook. Summary of the fields:
- Stages: There can be up to 10 stages. Each stage should have a power level and cook time. Reserved data exists for future use.
- Cook Action: Tells the device what to do with the cook request. The update action at enum value of 2 is not supported at the moment.
- Recipe ID: identifies the stage content so that it is unique.

erds.name: Staged Microwave Cook Status
erds.description: The status of the currently running staged cook. This is supplemental to the Microwave state (0x5C11).

data.name: Remaining Stage Cook Time In Seconds

erds.name: Customer Feedback Request
erds.description: Request to enable or disable different customer feedback

erds.name: Customer Feedback Status
erds.description: Current state of the customer feedback enables

erds.name: Downgrade Count
erds.description:
Counter that specifies the number of Appliance OTA Downgrades that can be performed.
This ERD is used to support Repetitive Appliance OTA Tests that loop between 2 eAUI Versions.
The Downgrades will only be allowed while in the Field Test Environment.
The WIFI Module will decrement the counter as the downgrades are performed.

erds.name: Bluetooth Low Energy Master Network Status
erds.description: Reading this will give you the current network status and writing this will control the network status.

erds.description: Reading this will give you the current values of scan filter 0 and writing this will control the scan filter 0 whose fields will be checked for match after receiving new BLE scan result.

The client can request a change to the User Cooling Setpoint Minimum Limit. Only User Cooling Setpoint Minimum Limits that the device allows will be accepted.
Whether or not the request was accepted, the appliance resets this Erd to 0x7FFF as an indication the request was 'consumed' and have it ready for the next request.

erds.name: User Cooling Setpoint Minimum Limit Allowed Range
erds.description: The device shall publish the range of values that are allowed for the User Cooling Setpoint Minimum Limit

User Cooling Setpoint Minimum Limit - Maximum Allowed Value in Fahrenheit x 10

erds.name: User Cooling Setpoint Maximum Limit Request
erds.description:
The client can request a change to the User Cooling Setpoint Maximum Limit. Only User Cooling Setpoint Maximum Limits that the device allows will be accepted.
Whether or not the request was accepted, the appliance resets this Erd to 0x7FFF as an indication the request was 'consumed' and have it ready for the next request.

erds.name: User Cooling Setpoint Maximum Limit Allowed Range
erds.description: The device shall publish the range of values that are allowed for the User Cooling Setpoint Maximum Limit

The client can request a change to Fan setting that the appliance uses when in Heat System Mode. Only Fan settings that the device allows will be accepted.
Whether or not the request was accepted, the appliance resets this Erd to 0xFF as an indication the request was 'consumed' and have it ready for the next request.

erds.name: Coffee Brewer Current Brew Settings
erds.description:
The current settings that define the brew indicated to the
user on the machine UI.

Parameters:
- Setting Gold - The user has selected to populate other
  settings with values that represent a Gold brew.  These
  values are defined by the unit.
- Setting Bloom Dwell - The user has selected to overwrite
  the default bloom dwell time settings defined by the unit.
- Setting Bloom Pump - The user has selected to overwrite
  the default bloom pump settings defined by the unit.
- Serving Single - The user wants to brew to a mug/cup
  versus to a carafe.
- Strength - The strength of the coffee the user wants to
  brew represented as a numerical value.
- Temperature - The temperature of the coffee the user
  wants to dispense.
- Single Volume - The number of ounces the user wants
  to dispense to a cup/mug.
- Carafe Volume - The number of cups the user wants to
  dispense to a carafe.
- Grind Time Delta - The change in grinding time compared to the default grinding time.
  Since negative values are supported, the value shall be represented in 2's complement format.
- Bloom Dwell Time - The amount of time the coffee grounds
  are soaked to provoke release carbon dioxide during bloom.

erds.name: Coffee Brewer Request Brew Settings
erds.description:
The requested settings that define the brew selections by the user on the client.
- Action field
  - Update Settings - Used to stage a brew. The settings are updated to give the ability
    to define 1 or more settings at a time before starting a brew.
  - Start Brew - Used to start dispensing a brew. The brew will start with the settings as defined.

See ERD 0x9051 for parameter definition.
See ERD 0x905A for parameter boundary limits.

erds.name: Coffee Brewer Brew Setting Limits
erds.description:
The boundary limits for all brew settings.

Parameters:
- Min Strength - The lowest numeric setting for brew strength
- Max Brew Strength - The highest numeric setting for brew strength
- Min Temperature - The lowest temperature to brew coffee
- Max Temperature - The highest temperature to brew coffee
- Min Single Volume - The minimum number of ounces to dispense to a cup/mug
- Max Single Volume - The maximum number of ounces to dispense to a cup/mug
- Min Carafe Volume - The minimum number of cups to dispense to a carafe
- Max Carafe Volume - The maximum number of cups to dispense to a carafe
- Min Grind Time Delta - The maximum amount of time that can be subtracted from the default grind time
- Max Grind Time Delta - The maximum amount of time that can be add to the default grind time
- Min Bloom Dwell Time - The least amount of time the grounds will soak during coffee bloom
- Max Bloom Dwell Time - The most amount of time the grounds will soak during coffee bloom

erds.name: Tank Drain Frequency Setting
erds.description:
This ERD is used to read/set an decrease in the count of icemaking cycles after which a drain cycle is carried out.
This count adjustment can be set in 2 steps (the count values are defined in the firmware) and matches the setting options provided to the user through the user interface.
Impurities in the water accumulate (the clear ice cubes are free of impurities, the impurities are left behind in the water) and can cause cloudy cubes when the TDS of the water source is high.
A higher frequency of drain cycles helps deal with source water with high TDS.

erds.name: Harvest Time Adjustment Setting
erds.description:
This ERD is used to read/set an increase in the time for which the ice mold is heated at the end of an ice making period to harvest the ice cubes.
The time adjustment can be set in 2 steps (the time values are defined in the firmware) and matches the setting options provided to the user through the user interface.

erds.name: Ice Maker Model
erds.description:
The value represents the model configuration for the ice maker. Some of the key differences that impact software are as follows:
- New Power Boards have a lower baud rate (19200) compared to the Legacy Power Boards (230400).
- The difference between Opal 2.0 and Opal 2.5 is the addition of Sanitize Indication on the Opal 2.5.
- Opal 2.1 & 2.6 have new power boards and are updated versions of Opal 2.0 and 2.5 respectively the key difference being the addition of a Filter Button and Water Level Sensor at the bottom reservoir.
- The Opal Mini is smaller in dimension. The Water reservoir is on the top, Accessories like the water tank, filter, etc are not compatible with previous models.

erds.name: Ice Maker Push Notifications
erds.description:
- Byte 0 & 1 - Individual bits set to indicate different push notifications.
    When setting a notification, only the particular bit must be set,
    other bits must be masked off to prevent pushing the same notification multiple times.

    * Sanitize Alert - Intended to remind the user to sanitize the appliance.
    * Water Filter Near Expiration Alert - Intended to remind the user to order a replacement filter.
    * Clean Air Filter Alert - Intended to remind the user to clean the air filter.

- Byte 2 & 3 - Bits are set to indicate that the user can enable or disable the corresponding notification in the client.
    Bits are cleared to indicate the notification is unsupported and hence cannot be enabled or disabled by the user.

erds.name: Time To Descale

The value represents the time elapsed between descale indications.
- 0% indicates a descale cycle was just executed.
- 100% & above indicates descale alert triggered.

erds.name: Toaster Oven Cooking Push Notifications
erds.description:
Byte 0 - Individual bits set to indicate cook cycle progression. Used to flag the notification pushed to user.
         When setting a bit, other bits must be masked off to prevent pushing same notification multiple times
         during a single cooking cycle. All bits cleared at the end of cooking cycle after oven door is opened.
  Target Temperature Achieved Bit - The oven has reached the target cooking temperature.
  Cooking Started Bit - The oven has started the cooking cycle and cooktime is counting down.
  Cooktime Down to Last Minute Bit - The oven has one minute left in the cooking cycle.
  Cooking Complete Bit - The oven has completed the cooking cycle. Cooktime reached 0.

Byte 1 - Bits are set to indicate that the user can enable or disable the corresponding notification in the client.
         Bits are cleared to indicate the notification is unsupported and hence can NOT be enabled or disabled by user.

erds.name: Mixer Mode State
erds.description: Mixer mode state corresponding to the state of the mixer given position of the mixer dial and other factors that can overwrite the dial position to an off state.

erds.name: Mixer Control Current Settings
erds.description:
Current mixer control settings include: the mixer direction, speed, mixing cycle timer set value, and mixing cycle torque profile values.
The torque profile values require a time when to sample the baseline torque during the mix cycle and the change in torque to exit the mix
cycle. The mixer mixing cycle is defined by these settings. The exit conditions for the mixing cycle are the timer set value and/or the
delta torque value.

erds.name: Mixer Control Requested Settings
erds.description:
Requested mixer control settings include: the mixer direction, speed, mixing cycle timer set value, mixing cycle torque profile values, and a requested setting mask.
The mixer mixing cycle is defined by these settings. The exit conditions for the mixing cycle are the timer set value and/or the torque profile values. The torque
profile values include the time when the baseline torque must be sampled during the mix cycle and the change in torque necessary to exit the mix cycle. The client
requests a mixing cycle with these settings or a subset of these settings as defined by the mask. The client may send each setting one at a time before the mixing
cycle is started. The device will define the settings that can be modified by the client in ERD 0x9309. Request to modify settings that are not available for
modification will be ignored.

data.name: Requested Setting Mask.Timer Set Value Requested

erds.name: Mixer Control Settings Limits
erds.description: Mixer control settings limits. The min and max values the user can set for speed, timer set value, and torque profile values.

Torque Profile Max Baseline Sample Time (Seconds)

erds.name: Mixer Pause Mixing Cycle
erds.description: Used to pause the mixing cycle. Write a 1 (true) to pause.

erds.name: Mixer State
erds.description: Mixer state during remote mode. Used to give feedback to the user indicating the progression of a mixing cycle.

erds.name: Mixer Notifications
erds.description:
Mixer notifications include conditions that cause mixing cycle to exit as well as conditions that prompt the user to take action.

Byte 0 - Individual bits set to indicate the condition is present and used to flag the notification pushed to user.
  - Out of Balance Bit - Prompt user - The mixing cycle slowed down because the mixer load is out of balance. Mixer will reset the bit when a new cycle is started or the condition is cleared.
  - Sudden Stop Bit - Exit cycle - The mixing cycle stopped because of at least one unexpected event. Mixer will reset the bit when a new cycle is started or the condition is cleared.
  - Check Calibration Bit - Prompt user - The mixer is due for calibration. The client will reset the bit using ERD 0x9307.
  - Mixing Cycle Complete Bit - Exit cycle - The mixing cycle stopped because either the timer reached 0 or the torque profile delta torque met. Mixer will reset the bit when a new cycle is started.
  - Scale Target Weight Reached - Prompt user - Used for recipes to prompt user to advance to the next step in the recipe. Mixer will reset the bit when a new target weight it set or the scale is tared.
  - Auto Sense Error Detect Response - Prompt user - The Auto Sense Error Detection Algorithmn has been invoked. Mixer will reset the bit when the condition is cleared.

Byte 1 - Bits are set to indicate that the user can enable or disable the corresponding notification in the client. Bits are cleared to indicate the notification is unsupported and hence can NOT be enabled or disabled by user.

erds.name: Mixer Control v2 Current
erds.description:
The current Mixer Control v2 parameter values. These parameters define the current or pending mixer cycle.

A mixer cycle is considered to be pending when some parameter values have been set to non-default values. A pending cycle becomes active when the user performs a start action. When a cycle is active and a cancel action occurs, the cycle will become pending. A cancel action when a cycle is pending will clear the cycle, resetting all parameters to their default values.

If the device leaves the remote operation mode, all parameters will be reset to their default values.

When an Active Stir cycle is active Direction will be Active Stir and Speed will update to always report the actual current speed, which will be either Active Stir Speed A or B.

data.name: Auto Sense Time After Peak Enabled
Auto Sense Error Detect Min Valid Torque (mN-m)
Auto Sense Error Detect Max Valid Torque (mN-m)
Auto Sense Error Detect Start Time (Seconds)

erds.name: Mixer Control v2 Requested
erds.description:
Request changes to the Mixer Control v2 parameters. These parameters define the current or pending mixer cycle.

Parameters may be set individually or in groups. The mask bits are used to indicate which parameters are currently being set. If a mask bit is zero, the parameters associated to that mask bit will be ignored. This allows a cycle to be built up one parameter at a time, or fully defined with a single request.

If a request contains invalid parameter values the invalid values will be ignored. Valid parameter values will be accepted. "Mixer Control v2 Current" will update to reflect accepted values. A value is invalid if it is disallowed by "Mixer Control v2 Limits", if it would change a parameter that is not available for modification as per "Mixer Control v2 Modification Availability", or if it would contradict another value, such as attempting to set "Time After Peak (Seconds)" while "Time After Peak Enabled" is false. Possible conflicts are outlined in detail below.

Restrictions on parameter values:
- If Direction is NOT set to Active Stir, Active Stir parameters will NOT be evaluated.
- When Direction is set to Active Stir, Active Stir parameters must also be set to valid values. If valid Active Stir parameters are not included in the request, the direction will be unchanged.
- If Direction IS set to Active Stir, Speed parameter will NOT be evaluated and will be cleared to zero.
- If Timer Set Time is set, when the timer expires the cycle will end immediately, regardless of Auto Sense status.
- If Auto Sense Torque Delta Type is set to Absolute, Torque Delta will be interpreted as Milli Newton Meters. If Auto Sense Torque Delta Type is set to Relative, Torque Delta will be interpreted as Percent.
- If Torque Delta is not set (or is set to zero) Auto Sense will not run and no other Auto Sense parameters will be evaluated.
- If Baseline Type is set to Single Sample then Baseline Window Time will not be evaluated.
- If Time After Peak Enable is set to Disable then Time After Peak Duration will not be evaluated.
- Auto Sense Error Detect Valid Torque Min must be less than Valid Torque Max. If Min is greater than or equal to Max, Error Detection parameters will be ignored.

erds.name: Mixer Control v2 Limits
erds.description:
Limits for Mixer Control v2. The limits define what values the device will accept for the various Mixer Control v2 parameters.

"True Min Speed" is the actual minimum value which may be written to the speed parameter, but this value corresponds to off and will not cause the motor to operate. "Min Operational Speed" is the minimum speed at which the motor can operate. Values between "True Min Speed" and "Min Operation Speed" are considered invalid and will be ignored.

"Max Active Stir Speed Difference" is the maximum difference between the two active stir speeds. For example, if the "Max Active Stir Speed Difference" is 0, the two Active Stir speeds much be the same.

erds.name: Mixer Control v2 Modification Availability
erds.description:
Modification Availability for Mixer Control v2. Each bit represents whether the corresponding parameters may be modified. If the bit is 1, parameter may be changed. If the bit is 0, the device will not accept changes to the corresponding parameters.

For example, the device may allow changes to the remaining time on a running timer, but may not allow changes to the parameters of a more complex algorithm while the algorithm is running.'

erds.name: Smoker Push Notifications
erds.description:
- Byte 0 & 1 - Individual bits set to indicate different push notifications.
    When setting a notification, only the particular bit must be set,
    other bits must be masked off to prevent pushing the same notification multiple times.
    All bits are cleared at the end of the cooking cycle after the oven door is opened.
    The warm hold periodic alerts bit is cleared in about a minute after it is set to facilitate future warm hold alerts.
    The door open alert bit is cleared when the door is closed.
    * Cooking Started Bit - The unit has initiated cooking.
    * Cooking Complete Bit - The unit has completed cooking, either cook time has expired or the probe temperature has reached the target.
    * Cooking Complete Early Notification Bit - The cycle is close to completion based on cook time remaining or probe temperature remaining from the target.
    * Preheat Complete Bit - The unit has achieved the target set temperature and smoke. The unit is ready to cook.
    * Warm Hold Periodic Alert Bit - The alert is triggered periodically every 1/2/3 hours based on user setting while in warm mode.
    * Fault Bit - The unit has encountered a fault. The notification is generic for all faults.
    * Door Open Alert - The door has been left open for a predefined amount of time while the cavity is active.
    * Smoke Clear Alert - Smoke has been cleared from the unit. Typically based on sub-state transtion from smoking to cooking.

- Byte 2 & 3 - Bits are set to indicate that the user can enable or disable the corresponding notification in the client.
    Bits are cleared to indicate the notification is unsupported and hence cannot be enabled or disabled by the user.

erds.name: Total Elapsed Warming Time
erds.description: The total number of minutes since warming started.

erds.name: Preheat Progress
erds.description: Tracks Preheat cycle progress to completion

erds.name: Sourdough Starter Status
erds.description:
Sourdough Starter Status:
* Mode: The current operating mode of the sourdough starter feature.
* State: The current state of the sourdough starter process.

Data Applicable only in Auto Mode:
* Goal Amount (grams): The target amount of starter to be produced in grams (User Input).
* Goal Day: The day of the week when the user expects the starter to be ready (User Input).
* Goal Time HR, Min: The Time of Day (24-hour format) when the user expects the starter to be ready (User Input).
* Time Since Complete (Minutes): The time elapsed since the Auto mode was last completed.

Data Applicable only in By Ratio Mode:
* Starter Ratio: The ratio of starter in the mixture (User Input).
* Flour Ratio: The ratio of flour in the mixture (User Input).
* Water Ratio: The ratio of water in the mixture (User Input).

Data Applicable only in By Mass Mode:
* Flour Mass (grams): The mass of flour used in grams (User Input).
* Water Mass (grams): The mass of water used in grams (User Input).

Data Applicable only in By Ratio Mode and By Mass Mode:
* Feeding Frequency (Minutes): The frequency at which feedings occur, in minutes (User Input).
* Time To Crock Full (Minutes): Estimated time until the crock is full, in minutes.
* Current Starter Mass (grams): The current mass of the starter in grams.

data.name: Goal Time HR: Time of Day (24 - Hour Format)
Goal Time Min: Time of Day (0 - 60 Minutes)

erds.name: Ambient Temperature
erds.description: The ambient temperature.

erds.name: Temperature Offset Status
erds.description: The current value of temperature offset setting

erds.name: Temperature Offset Request
erds.description: The requested value of temperature offset setting

erds.name: Temperature Offset Limits
erds.description: The limits for temperature offset setting

erds.name: Sourdough Starter Push Notifications
erds.description:
- Byte 0 & 1 - Individual bits set to indicate different push notifications.
    When setting a notification, only the particular bit must be set,
    other bits must be masked off to prevent pushing the same notification multiple times.

    * Mode Complete Alert - Intended to indicate mode completion.
    * Crock Nearly Full Alert - Intended to alert the user that the crock is nearly full.
    * Crock Full Alert - Intended to alert the user that the crock is full.
    * Crock Removed Alert - Intended to alert the user that the crock has been removed (The firmware has additional logic, regarding when the notification should be triggered).
    * Power Loss Alert - Intended to alert the user that a power loss event has occurred.

- Byte 2 & 3 - Bits are set to indicate that the user can enable or disable the corresponding notification in the client.
    Bits are cleared to indicate the notification is unsupported and hence cannot be enabled or disabled by the user.

erds.name: Temporary Temperature Offset Demand Response Request
erds.description: Specifies the parameters for a Temperature Offset Demand Response Event

erds.name: Temporary Temperature Offset Demand Response Status
erds.description: Status of the Temporary Temperature Offset DR Event

erds.name: Cost of power cost/comfort slider request
erds.description:
This allows the client to balance cost savings against comfort in the form of stable water temperature
A value of 0 will allow full cost savings, which will vary the water heater tank setpoint and charging
times in order to maximize use of off-peak power and reduce or eliminate peak priced power.
A value of 255 will prioritize temperature setpoint stability at the expense of sometimes using peak
priced power.
Values between 0 and 255 give a sliding scale of temperature stability vs cost savings

priced power.
Values between 0 and 255 give a sliding scale of temperature stability vs cost savings

erds.name: Electrical Pricing Structure Selection Status
erds.description: Status of what pricing structure the appliance is currently using as well as all of the pricing structures the appliance can support.

erds.name: Electrical Pricing Structure Selection Request
erds.description: Request of what pricing structure the appliance should be using.

erds.name: Electrical Time of Use Pricing Schedule Request - Season 1
erds.description:
Request to write a new electrical time of use pricing schedule to the appliance for one season of prices.

This ERD contains up to 5 daily pricing events and is organized per day of the week. Each pricing event in each day of the week has
a pricing tier level and a start time of the pricing event. The pricing tier level can be thought of as an eumeration of pricing tiers and
the value of the price is always increasing as the tier increases. For example, Tier 0 {value 0x00 in Daily Pricing Tiers} is the lowest
price value for that day. If a Tier 3 existed {value 0x03 in Daily Pricing Tiers} then the value of that price would be larger than Tier 0,
Tier 1, and Tier 2. This ERD also provides the maximum Tier value for this current time of use pricing structure.

This TOU pricing ERD represents one season of TOU prices and therefore the over all pricing structure has a start month and start day of month in which this
pricing schedule will begin in that year. Note that Season 1 must begin on January 1.

The start time is in minutes for the total minutes in that day. For example, a start time value of 0x0001 would mean the event starts at 12:01 on that day.
A start time of 0x059F (1439) would mean the event starts at 11:59 PM that day.

There is an associated ERD that also provides a mapping of the Pricing Tier value to an actual price if there are clients
that want to provide actual pricing estimates.

There is an associated ERD that has a SHA256 of all of the data inside this ERD so clients can use this to verify they have successfully
received and written all of the correct data.

erds.name: Electrical Pricing Time of Use Schedule Hash Status - Season 1
erds.description:
The SHA-256 hash of all of the electrical pricing time of use schedule data in the Electrical Time of Use Pricing Schedule - Season 1 ERD. This is the
hash for one season of TOU pricing and therefore only the Season 1 ERD.

This ERD should be used in conjunction with the Electrical Pricing TOU Schedule ERD and devices will update this ERD with the SHA of the TOU 
schedule for that season, clients will then use this ERD to determine if the pricing schedule that was written is correct. 
The value of this ERD should reflect the SHA-256 hash of the data in the Electrical
Pricing Time of Use Schedule ERD. If a client writes the pricing schedule ERD, then this ERD should be updated to reflect that change. If there is an invalid
schedule written to the Pricing Time of Use Schedule ERD, then this ERD should be written to all 0's to indicate an issue with the schedule. A
valid schedule would mean that the SHA-256 of the Pricing Time of Use Schedule ERD matches the data in the Electrical Pricing Time of Use Schedule
ERD. When that ERD is written, until there is a valid schedule, this ERD should be set to all 0's.

This is sample code that defines how this SHA will be calculated on the device sha256(&erdStruct, sizeof(erdStruct)).

erds.name: Electrical Time of Use Pricing Schedule Request - Season 4
erds.description:
Request to write a new electrical time of use pricing schedule to the appliance for one season of prices.

This ERD contains up to 5 daily pricing events and is organized per day of the week. Each pricing event in each day of the week has
a pricing tier level and a start time of the pricing event. The pricing tier level can be thought of as an eumeration of pricing tiers and
the value of the price is always increasing as the tier increases. For example, Tier 0 {value 0x00 in Daily Pricing Tiers} is the lowest
price value for that day. If a Tier 3 existed {value 0x03 in Daily Pricing Tiers} then the value of that price would be larger than Tier 0,
Tier 1, and Tier 2. This ERD also provides the maximum Tier value for this current time of use pricing structure.

This TOU pricing ERD represents one season of TOU prices and therefore the over all pricing structure has a start month and start day of month in which this
pricing schedule will begin in that year.

The start time is in minutes for the total minutes in that day. For example, a start time value of 0x0001 would mean the event starts at 12:01 on that day.
A start time of 0x059F (1439) would mean the event starts at 11:59 PM that day.

There is an associated ERD that also provides a mapping of the Pricing Tier value to an actual price if there are clients
that want to provide actual pricing estimates.

There is an associated ERD that has a SHA256 of all of the data inside this ERD so clients can use this to verify they have successfully
received and written all of the correct data.

erds.name: Electrical Pricing Time of Use Schedule Hash Status - Season 4
erds.description:
The SHA-256 hash of all of the electrical pricing time of use schedule data in the Electrical Time of Use Pricing Schedule - Season 4 ERD. This is the
hash for one season of TOU pricing and therefore only the Season 4 ERD.

This ERD should be used in conjunction with the Electrical Pricing TOU Schedule ERD and devices will update this ERD with the SHA of the TOU 
schedule for that season, clients will then use this ERD to determine if the pricing schedule that was written is correct. 
The value of this ERD should reflect the SHA-256 hash of the data in the Electrical
Pricing Time of Use Schedule ERD. If a client writes the pricing schedule ERD, then this ERD should be updated to reflect that change. If there is an invalid
schedule written to the Pricing Time of Use Schedule ERD, then this ERD should be written to all 0's to indicate an issue with the schedule. A
valid schedule would mean that the SHA-256 of the Pricing Time of Use Schedule ERD matches the data in the Electrical Pricing Time of Use Schedule
ERD. When that ERD is written, until there is a valid schedule, this ERD should be set to all 0's.

This is sample code that defines how this SHA will be calculated on the device sha256(&erdStruct, sizeof(erdStruct)).

erds.name: Appliance Cumulative Energy
erds.description:
The cumulative energy usage in Wh. The update rate for this ERD is configurable by 0xD014, with the fastest rate being 1 min.
This must be stored in NV and must be cumulative across power cycles.
